message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for text classification based on clustering word embeddings, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses k-means algorithm, which is a clustering algorithm commonly used in machine learning, and proposes to build class-specific vocabularies, which is related to classification and information retrieval. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the bag of visual words model, which is a widely used model in computer vision, and proposes a similar approach for text classification. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also a possible sub-category.
